### 1.

```{r}
shoe_size <- c(6.5, 9.0, 8.5, 8.5, 10.5, 7.0, 9.5, 9.0, 13.0, 7.5, 10.5, 8.5, 12.0, 10.5, 13.0, 11.5, 8.5, 5.0, 10.0, 6.5, 7.5, 8.5, 10.5, 8.5, 10.5, 11.0, 9.0, 13.0)
height <- c(66.0, 68.0, 64.5, 65.0, 70.0, 64.0, 70.0, 71.0, 72.0, 64.0, 74.5, 67.0, 71.0, 71.0, 77.0, 72.0, 59.0, 62.0, 72.0, 66.0, 64.0, 67.0, 73.0, 69.0, 72.0, 70.0, 69.0, 70.0)
gender <- c("F", "F", "F", "F", "M", "F", "F", "F", "M", "F", "M", "F", "M", "M", "M", "M", "F", "F", "M", "F", "F", "M", "M", "F", "M", "M", "M", "M")

shoes_df <- data.frame(
  "Shoe size" = shoe_size,
  "Height" = height,
  "Gender" = gender
)
View(shoes_df)
```

### a.

The data is a class of dataframe with a total of 28 observations of 3 variables: Shoe size, Height, and Gender.

### b.

```{r}
library(dplyr)

maleSet <- shoes_df %>%
  filter(Gender == "M") %>%
  select(Shoe.size, Height)

femaleSet <- shoes_df %>%
  filter(Gender == "F") %>%
  select(Shoe.size, Height)

maleSet
femaleSet
```

### c.

```{r}
shoe_size_mean <- mean(shoes_df$Shoe.size)
cat("the mean of Shoe size is:", shoe_size_mean)

height_mean <- mean(shoes_df$Height)
cat("\nthe mean of height is:", height_mean)
```
